nodes.name: Jon Hanson
nodes.description: CEO/Founder of Skill Tree Marketing, whose brainchild is the company's bootstrapped success.

nodes.name: Skill Tree Marketing
nodes.description: A marketing agency co-founded by Jon Hanson, specializing in game marketing and utilizing AI-driven processes.

nodes.name: Nate Mordo
nodes.description: Marketing professional at Skill Tree Marketing, passionate about brand marketing and learning growth, with a focus on refining AI context engineering.

nodes.name: Nate Rudichuk
nodes.description: A professional with over 10 years in the video game industry on the product side, interested in tooling for creative and Go-To-Market strategies.

nodes.name: Marketing Process
nodes.description: Skill Tree Marketing's structured methodology, from client engagement to strategy development and campaign execution.

nodes.name: Client
nodes.description: The recipient of Skill Tree Marketing's services, providing game information and sales goals.

nodes.name: Game Information
nodes.description: Detailed data about a client's game, essential for developing a tailored marketing strategy.

nodes.name: Game Sales Goals
nodes.description: Specific sales objectives for a game, provided by the client, which guide the marketing strategy.

nodes.name: AirTable
nodes.description: A flexible database platform used by Skill Tree Marketing to input and manage client context and information.

nodes.name: Automation
nodes.description: The use of automated systems and processes, including agentic workflows and deep research loops, within the marketing process.

nodes.name: Agentic Workflows
nodes.description: Automated, intelligent processes that take initial context and build the basis for marketing strategies through deep research.

nodes.name: Deep Research
nodes.description: An intensive research process, often part of agentic workflows, utilizing tools like Perplexity and ChatGPT.

nodes.name: Strategy Development
nodes.description: The phase of building and enriching marketing approaches based on gathered context and research.

nodes.name: Social Strategy
nodes.description: A specific marketing strategy focused on social media platforms, spun up after the core approach is built.

nodes.name: John Cedar
nodes.description: A professional from Game Data Pros who collaborates with Skill Tree Marketing on structuring AI prompts.

nodes.name: Game Data Pros
nodes.description: An organization collaborating with Skill Tree Marketing on aspects of AI prompt engineering, specifically with John Cedar.

nodes.name: Prompt Engineering
nodes.description: The process of structuring prompts for AI models, including considering counterfactual reasoning, to achieve desired strategic outputs.

nodes.name: Audience Segmentation
nodes.description: The process of predicting how different segments of a target audience will react to specific marketing messages.

nodes.name: First-Party Data
nodes.description: Proprietary data, such as retention metrics, collected directly from clients, used to enrich marketing context.

nodes.name: Retention Metrics
nodes.description: Specific performance indicators related to user engagement and retention, part of first-party data.

nodes.name: Google AI Studio
nodes.description: A platform where Skill Tree Marketing's internal AI tools are developed and where their 'trained models' (prompt-chain contexts) reside.

nodes.name: Internal AI Tools
nodes.description: Custom AI-powered tools created by Skill Tree Marketing for internal efficiency, explicitly not built as standalone products.

nodes.name: AI Value Addition
nodes.description: The strategic application of AI to enhance marketing processes, provide insights, and generate efficiency.

nodes.name: Sensor Tower
nodes.description: An external data analytics platform from which Skill Tree Marketing explicitly states they do not mine data.

nodes.name: Apps Flyer
nodes.description: An external mobile attribution and marketing analytics platform from which Skill Tree Marketing explicitly states they do not mine data.

nodes.name: Trained Model
nodes.description: A 'Google AI Studio prompt-chain context' that encapsulates refined AI prompts and configurations, serving as a reusable base for campaigns.

nodes.name: Context Engineering
nodes.description: The problem of identifying and enabling editing of information components to continually feed and change the context within AI models.

nodes.name: Campaign Feedback Loop
nodes.description: The process of feeding campaign results and data back into the AI model to correct and improve future marketing campaigns.

nodes.name: Perplexity AI
nodes.description: An AI-powered search and answer engine used by Skill Tree Marketing for deep research queries.

nodes.name: ChatGPT
nodes.description: A large language model used by Skill Tree Marketing for deep research, noted for having query caps.

nodes.name: Vector Database
nodes.description: A type of database desired by Nate Rudichuk for efficiently storing and retrieving large volumes of data, especially for semantic search.

nodes.name: Creative & GTM Strategy
nodes.description: The combination of creative development and Go-To-Market strategy, a primary interest for tooling from Nate Rudichuk's perspective.

nodes.name: Recurring Revenue Model
nodes.description: Skill Tree Marketing's business model, geared towards continuous revenue through ongoing client relationships.

nodes.name: GPT Insights
nodes.description: Information and analysis derived from GPT models, which Nate Rudichuk notes can quickly become dated or 'yesterday's insights'.

nodes.name: Social Media Tool
nodes.description: A desired AI-powered tool for social media and creative directors to offer strategy services based on data.

nodes.name: Synthetic Data
nodes.description: Artificially generated data that mimics real-world data, used as an alternative or supplement for strategy development.

nodes.name: Customer Profiles
nodes.description: Detailed descriptions of target customers used to build profiles and agents for strategic planning.

nodes.name: Social Media Integration
nodes.description: The process of connecting with and analyzing social media platforms, including scraping information on post performance and audience behavior.

nodes.name: Game Design Documents
nodes.description: Official documents detailing a game's design, used as an input for positioning the game in the market.

nodes.name: Google Docs
nodes.description: A cloud-based word processor used by Nate Mordo for managing documents in a live workflow.

nodes.name: Spreadsheets
nodes.description: Digital tables used by Nate Mordo for organizing data as part of a live workflow.

nodes.name: Gamma AI
nodes.description: An AI-powered presentation tool (gamma.app) used to build marketing decks from generated content.

nodes.name: Client Intake
nodes.description: The initial phase of gathering essential information from a client via forms to initiate a project.

nodes.name: Client Presentation
nodes.description: A pitch or strategy deck presented to clients, built upon research from earlier stages of the marketing process.

nodes.name: Research-Acceptance Gap
nodes.description: The discrepancy or challenge that arises when assumptions baked into initial research differ from client acceptance or real-world outcomes.
